info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued November 17 at 4:43AM PST until November 17 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, visibility of a half mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...Freezing fog will affect areas along highway 62 east of Crater Lake to Chiloquin, including the Fort Klamath area. * WHEN...For the Freezing Fog Advisory, until 9 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost and slippery conditions on roadways. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If possible, wait for temperatures to warm above freezing before traveling. * Slow down and give 3 times as much space as normal between vehicles. * Shaded areas may be more slippery than unshaded areas. * Use low beams. High beams reflect back fog making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are. * Be ready for low visibility by keeping your headlights clean. * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.
